verses.verse: Woe<WH1945> to thee that spoilest<WH7703>, and thou wast not spoiled<WH7703>; and dealest treacherously<WH898>, and they dealt not treacherously<WH898> with thee! when thou shalt cease<WH8552> to spoil<WH7703>, thou shalt be spoiled<WH7703>; and when thou shalt make an end<WH5239> to deal treacherously<WH898>, they shall deal treacherously<WH898> with thee.
O LORD<WH3068>, be gracious<WH2603> unto us; we have waited<WH6960> for thee: be thou their arm<WH2220> every morning<WH1242>, our salvation<WH3444> also in the time<WH6256> of trouble<WH6869>.
At the noise<WH6963> of the tumult<WH1995> the people<WH5971> fled<WH5074>; at the lifting up<WH7427> of thyself the nations<WH1471> were scattered<WH5310>.
And your spoil<WH7998> shall be gathered<WH622> like the gathering<WH625> of the caterpiller<WH2625>: as the running to and fro<WH4944> of locusts<WH1357> shall he run<WH8264> upon them.
The LORD<WH3068> is exalted<WH7682>; for he dwelleth<WH7931> on high<WH4791>: he hath filled<WH4390> Zion<WH6726> with judgment<WH4941> and righteousness<WH6666>.

And wisdom<WH2451> and knowledge<WH1847> shall be the stability<WH530> of thy times<WH6256>, and strength<WH2633> of salvation<WH3444>: the fear<WH3374> of the LORD<WH3068> is his treasure<WH214>. salvation: Heb. salvations
Behold, their valiant ones<WH691> shall cry<WH6817> without<WH2351>: the ambassadors<WH4397> of peace<WH7965> shall weep<WH1058> bitterly<WH4751>. valiant: or, messengers

The highways<WH4546> lie waste<WH8074>, the wayfaring man<WH5674> <WH734> ceaseth<WH7673>: he hath broken<WH6565> the covenant<WH1285>, he hath despised<WH3988> the cities<WH5892>, he regardeth<WH2803> no man<WH582>.

The earth<WH776> mourneth<WH56> and languisheth<WH535>: Lebanon<WH3844> is ashamed<WH2659> and hewn down<WH7060>: Sharon<WH8289> is like a wilderness<WH6160>; and Bashan<WH1316> and Carmel<WH3760> shake off<WH5287> their fruits. hewn: or, withered away
Now will I rise<WH6965>, saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>; now will I be exalted<WH7426>; now will I lift up<WH5375> myself.
Ye shall conceive<WH2029> chaff<WH2842>, ye shall bring forth<WH3205> stubble<WH7179>: your breath<WH7307>, as fire<WH784>, shall devour<WH398> you.
And the people<WH5971> shall be as the burnings<WH4955> of lime<WH7875>: as thorns<WH6975> cut up<WH3683> shall they be burned<WH3341> in the fire<WH784>.
Hear<WH8085>, ye that are far off<WH7350>, what I have done<WH6213>; and, ye that are near<WH7138>, acknowledge<WH3045> my might<WH1369>.

The sinners<WH2400> in Zion<WH6726> are afraid<WH6342>; fearfulness<WH7461> hath surprised<WH270> the hypocrites<WH2611>. Who among us shall dwell<WH1481> with the devouring<WH398> fire<WH784>? who among us shall dwell<WH1481> with everlasting<WH5769> burnings<WH4168>?

He that walketh<WH1980> righteously<WH6666>, and speaketh<WH1696> uprightly<WH4339>; he that despiseth<WH3988> the gain<WH1215> of oppressions<WH4642>, that shaketh<WH5287> his hands<WH3709> from holding<WH8551> of bribes<WH7810>, that stoppeth<WH331> his ears<WH241> from hearing<WH8085> of blood<WH1818>, and shutteth<WH6105> his eyes<WH5869> from seeing<WH7200> evil<WH7451>; righteously: Heb. in righteousnesses uprightly: Heb. uprightnesses oppressions: or, deceits blood: Heb. bloods

He shall dwell<WH7931> on high<WH4791>: his place of defence<WH4869> shall be the munitions<WH4679> of rocks<WH5553>: bread<WH3899> shall be given<WH5414> him; his waters<WH4325> shall be sure<WH539>. high: Heb. heights, or, high places
Thine eyes<WH5869> shall see<WH2372> the king<WH4428> in his beauty<WH3308>: they shall behold<WH7200> the land<WH776> that is very far off<WH4801>. that: Heb. of far distances
Thine heart<WH3820> shall meditate<WH1897> terror<WH367>. Where is the scribe<WH5608>? where is the receiver<WH8254>? where is he that counted<WH5608> the towers<WH4026>? receiver: Heb. weigher?

Thou shalt not see<WH7200> a fierce<WH3267> people<WH5971>, a people<WH5971> of a deeper<WH6012> speech<WH8193> than thou canst perceive<WH8085>; of a stammering<WH3932> tongue<WH3956>, that thou canst not understand<WH998>. stammering: or, ridiculous

Look<WH2372> upon Zion<WH6726>, the city<WH7151> of our solemnities<WH4150>: thine eyes<WH5869> shall see<WH7200> Jerusalem<WH3389> a quiet<WH7600> habitation<WH5116>, a tabernacle<WH168> that shall not be taken down<WH6813>; not one of the stakes<WH3489> thereof shall ever<WH5331> be removed<WH5265>, neither shall any of the cords<WH2256> thereof be broken<WH5423>.

But there the glorious<WH117> LORD<WH3068> will be unto us a place<WH4725> of broad<WH7342> <WH3027> rivers<WH5104> and streams<WH2975>; wherein shall go<WH3212> no<WH1077> galley<WH590> with oars<WH7885>, neither shall gallant<WH117> ship<WH6716> pass<WH5674> thereby. of: Heb. broad of spaces, or, hands
For the LORD<WH3068> is our judge<WH8199>, the LORD<WH3068> is our lawgiver<WH2710>, the LORD<WH3068> is our king<WH4428>; he will save<WH3467> us. lawgiver: Heb. statutemaker

Thy tacklings<WH2256> are loosed<WH5203>; they could not well<WH3653> strengthen<WH2388> their mast<WH8650>, they could not spread<WH6566> the sail<WH5251>: then is the prey<WH5706> of a great<WH4766> spoil<WH7998> divided<WH2505>; the lame<WH6455> take<WH962> the prey<WH957>. Thy: or, They have forsaken thy tacklings
And the inhabitant<WH7934> shall not say<WH559>, I am sick<WH2470>: the people<WH5971> that dwell<WH3427> therein shall be forgiven<WH5375> their iniquity<WH5771>.
